Perguntaram-me a resposta, mas eu não sabia. ― They asked me the answer, but I didn’t know.

defs._def: (transitive) to be aware of a value or piece of information
extras: Ele sabe duzentos algarismos do número neperiano. ― He knows two hundred digits of Euler’s number.
2003, J. K. Rowling, Lya Wyler, Harry Potter e a Ordem da Fênix, Rocco, page 46:
Eu sei qual é a capital da Assíria. ― I know what is the capital of Assyria.
Olho-Tonto, você sabe que isso é nojento, não sabe?
Mad-Eye, you know that this is disgusting, don't you?

defs._def: (auxiliary with a verb in the impersonal infinitive) to know how to do something
extras: Não sei fazer isso, mas ela sabe. ― I don’t know how to do this, but she knows.
Sabes falar russo? ― Can you speak Russian?

defs._def: (transitive with de or sobre) to know about; to have heard about
extras: Soube da explosão que houve no centro? ― Have you heard about the downtown explosion?

defs._def: (Portugal) (transitive with a) to taste of (to have the same taste as)
extras: Um bom vinho sabe a carvalho. ― A good wine tastes like oak.
Como sabe esse vinho! ― How good does this wine taste!

defs._def: to learn (to become informed of something)
extras: Eles querem saber mais sobre o projeto. ― They want to learn more about the project.

defs._def: first-person singular (eu) present indicative of conhecer; "I know"
first-person singular (eu) present indicative of desconhecer

a certeza de que nada mais terá o mesmo saborthe certainty that nothing else will have the same flavour
